RumorFact.Text: The construction of the Sanctuary used a new type of projection stone crafted at a workshop on Giant's Deep.
Projection stones for the Orbital Probe Cannon were crafted at a workshop on Statue Island.
Nomai using the voyager stones noticed their voyagers arriving outside the projection pool, and receiving visions from other voyages.
A new type of projection stone used the memory statues' memory storage systems to allow paired Nomai to explore remotely beyond projection pools.

ExploreFact.Text: This workshop on Giant's Deep was where Nomai scrolls and projection stones were crafted.
A new type of projection stone allowed Nomai to explore remotely beyond projection pools, granting them imperviousness to most hazards.

AltText.Text: A new type of projection stone used memory storage systems to allow Nomai to explore remotely beyond projection pools, granting them imperviousness to most hazards.

ExploreFact.Text: Conversations shared across projection stones are not stored on the stones themselves, but on the projection walls they were written on, which can only be read with the corresponding projection stones.
Up to one voyager per memory mask can remain on standby when disconnected, returning a voyage to its position when reconnected.
Voyaging to the same destination from the same projection pool can cause connection to a standby voyager from another memory mask, sharing the voyage with them.

RumorFact.Text: A group of Nomai discovered frozen jellyfish on this island, and sought higher elevation to study them.

ExploreFact.Text: The expedition team exploring Giant's Deep studied frozen jellyfish at this site.
The Nomai transported a frozen jellyfish back to the Looming City to study it, curious about why the jellyfish had not returned to the surface of the ocean.
A Nomai named Melorae expressed her curiosity about how the jellyfish would interact with the quantum shard in the Looming City.
The Nomai noticed the planet becoming completely dark, before what appeared to be a column of water launched the island into space.

RumorFact.Text: I found a frozen comet hidden in the shadow of Giant's Deep.
I entered a black hole at the center of the comet, which warped me into a space with glowing masks and ghost matter.

ExploreFact.Text: An artificial comet made of gravity crystals, made to bring destruction to the source of the Interloper..
The Inspired was repurposed to protect the Hearthians when its creator realized that they were endangered by ghost matter.
The Inspired's white hole warp core was replaced with a black hole warp core, allowing it to warp all collected ghost matter to the Deep Storm Station for containment.

RumorFact.Text: The Nomai made a camp on the shore of Statue Island during their first survey expedition to Giant's Deep.

ExploreFact.Text: This camp on Statue Island's shore sheltered Nomai from both Brittle Hollow and Ember Twin during their first survey expedition to Giant's Deep.
After encountering a cyclone, a Nomai named Melorae stressed the importance of a method of protecting themselves from visiting cyclones - or seeking a landmass clear of the path of cyclones entirely.
The Nomai discovered a species of tentacled lifeforms on Giant's Deep.

RumorFact.Text: The Nomai on Giant's Deep used to be completely insulated from cyclones in the Looming City.
A Nomai named Thatch proposed transporting a frozen jellyfish back to a habitat in the Looming City for research.
A Nomai named Melorae expressed her curiosity about how the jellyfish would interact with the quantum shard in the Looming City.
The Nomai abandoned this tower after a quantum shard invaded and caused its interior to become inhospitably quantum.

ExploreFact.Text: A great tower that once served as a Nomai settlement, built on an island within the eye of the hurricane.
The Nomai abandoned this tower due to extenuating circumstances, chronicled in scrolls within the tower.

AltText.Text: The Nomai abandoned this tower after a quantum shard invaded, and caused its interior to become inhospitably quantum.

ExploreFact.Text: A Nomai named Melorae discovered that quantum objects could be locked in place while observing them through photos. Her apprentice proudly celebrated their achievements as the greatest quantum geologists of their clan.

RumorFact.Text: The Nomai constructed a jellyfish habitat at the Looming City to conduct further research into them.

ExploreFact.Text: A Nomai named Solanum lost a scroll in this pool. A jellyfish at the bottom of the pool is blocking access to the scroll with its electrifying tentacles.
A bay on the opposite side of the Construction Yard, flooded by ghost matter.
I found schematics for something called the Inspired.

A Nomai named Cassava noticed storm shelters on the island powering on by themselves, even in the absence of cyclones. They were encouraged to visit the Gravity Crystal Workshop to inquire about this issue.
A Nomai named Cassava observed ghost matter being temporarily neutralized by water. He concluded that ghost matter could not penetrate water.

RumorFact.Text: There is a small cove on Gabbro's Island guarded by ghost matter.
Gabbro made a second campfire outside this cove, but abandoned it after finding the waves were washing high enough to extinguish it.
A Nomai named Daz tested a new type of projection stone with a Nomai named Cassava on this island. His voyager disappeared without warning during the test to Cassava’s alarm.

ExploreFact.Text: A small cove inside Gabbro's Island, filled with ghost matter.
A Nomai named Daz asked for the hand of another Nomai named Cassava in marriage in this cove! Strangely, Daz appeared to celebrate Cassava's acceptance of this proposal before he received an answer.
As the sun orbits overhead, its gravity causes waves to wash higher on the island. These waves washed high enough to dissolve Daz's voyager while he was testing a voyager stone.

RumorFact.Text: My scout was warped somewhere with a large structure at its core and wires connected to it built into the walls. The area is filled with clusters of crystals and patches of ghost matter.
A Nomai named Poke described the Deep Storm Station as a station built at the center of Giant's Deep.
I was able to safely enter the Deep Storm Station using a voyager stone. The gravity floor seems to be too strong for me to jump to the other side of the station.
Nomai journeyed to Giant's Deep to oversee a safety test being conducted at the Deep Storm Station.
Two Nomai named Pye and Idaea were confused by their inability to warp to the Deep Storm Station from a warp tower on Ash Twin.

ExploreFact.Text: I was able to enter the Deep Storm Station.

The Deep Storm Station used the electric core of Giant's Deep to power a 6-second negative time interval that would test the mechanics of the Ash Twin Project. A test was ran that gave the Nomai confidence in the operation of the Ash Twin Project.
A Nomai named Cassava was protected from some sort of extinction event aboard the Deep Storm Station. He was able to use voyager stones to travel and explore outside the station.

AltText.Text: A Nomai named Cassava survived the arrival of ghost matter in the star system aboard the Deep Storm Station. He was able to use voyager stones to travel and explore outside the station.

ExploreFact.Text: Realizing with horror that Hearthians were endangered by ghost matter, Cassava repurposed something called the Inspired to capture and contain ghost matter.

Cassava concluded that the safest and surest method of long-term containment of the captured matter was to warp it into Deep Storm Station using the station's paired warp cores - at the cost of his own life.
A recording in the Deep Storm Station contained Cassava's last words. The Nomai known as Cassava met his end without fear.

RumorFact.Text: Nomai on the Probe Tracking Module shared the results of the test with the Deep Storm Station through the module's projection whiteboard.
Daz and Cassava wrote to the Deep Storm Station through the projection whiteboard on Gabbro's Island to learn of the results of the test.

ExploreFact.Text: The projection whiteboard inside the upper floor of the Scroll and Stone Workshop discussed the failure of the Ash Twin Project, and concurrent exploration of a comet. The conversation was cut off short.
The projection whiteboard on Lovers' Cove revealed that Daz timed his marriage proposal with the Deep Storm Station test, in order to learn his spouse's answer 6 seconds in advance.
The projection whiteboard inside Statue Island recorded the successful excavation of the core of Giant's Deep to house the Deep Storm Station.

The projection whiteboard on Construction Yard detailed the installation of a paired warp core used to power the Deep Storm Station which would give the Nomai data to improve the advanced warp core for the Ash Twin Project.

The projection whiteboard in the Probe Tracking Module reveals the Deep Storm Station was created to test the systems of the Ash Twin project, creating a 6-second timeloop powered by the electric core of the planet to ensure safe functionality of the negative time interval.
The projection whiteboard in the Timber Hearth mines contains Cassava's ruminations on possible methods of containment of ghost matter captured using the Inspired.
